title: In the Harry Potter and Sorcerer’s Stone movie, why does Snape give Harry that look when he states they are “up to something”? - Quora
tags: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (2001 movie)

response.answer_text: He is capable of Legilimency, the art of invading people’s minds and interpreting their emotions, subtly. Furthermore, he was in close proximity to the Golden Trio when they were talking about him trying to steal the Sorcerer’s stone, so he wasn’t just guessing, he knew they were up to something. And that ‘something’ involved him. I think he was hoping to scare them out of going after the Stone (although whoever heard of Gryffindors being scared out of rushing ahead without thinking about the consequences?), so that Quirrell wouldn’t kill them. I don’t know if you’ve read all the books or seen all the movies, so I won’t reveal too much in case you haven’t, but what I can say is that he had a personal reason why he wanted to keep Harry alive.
